snippet: Since April, when President Pierre Nkurunziza said he would run for a contentious third term, this country in central Africa has had an ominous cloud hanging over it.
abstract: Violence is resurgent in Burundi, amid Pres Pierre Nkurunziza's controversial quest for third term; international pressure by politicians and human rights activists, while seemingly restraining government, may also be emboldening opposition; residents fear tenuous situation could devolve into another civil war.
lead_paragraph: Since April, when President Pierre Nkurunziza said he would run for a contentious third term, this country in central Africa has had an ominous cloud hanging over it.

headline.main: With Burundi’s President Sticking to Power, Violence Is on the Rise
headline.print_headline: With Burundi’s President Sticking to Power, Violence Is on the Rise

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
